website_summaries.verdict: The Canon PowerShot Elph 135 has an appealing price tag, but for just $10 more you can get an identical model with image stabilization.
cons: Lacks Wi-Fi and other advanced features

customer_reviews.title: My Mom loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Mom as a mothers day present. She loves it and has found it very easy to use. It takes great pictures. I did set her up with a couple of standard settings for indoor or outdoor. The auto feature seems to be a bit washed out in bright sunlight, so I set her Manual mode to be more geared towards that lighting. now she just has to switch between auto for indoor and manual for outdoor.
customer_reviews.author: Linny05

customer_reviews.title: Great all-around camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is replica of one I bought at full price and accidently left outside. Its a workhorse camera and I am a shutterbug. Its great for close up and distance wide or narrow. I won't say you get superior digital shots but you get quality enough to post on FB and get a great response. I would not even look at another camera. Love it that much. But, that said, I don't have a cell phone so can't compare to quality one of those that takes pics would provide. Old school here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonophile

customer_reviews.title: Back to Canon
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, instructions easy to understand, photos great. I returned complicated Samsung with instructions so small they couldn't be read.
customer_reviews.author: diane.cox

customer_reviews.title: Its just so easy to use to get great pictures
customer_reviews.text: I strayed away from Canon last year but never used my fancy new camera as much as I used my older Elph. Its just so easy to use to get great pictures. Even though my cellphone takes nice shots when you go to blow them up you get distorted images. With my Canon the pictures are clear and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: Replaced another camera that I lost, so I thought price was economical. At the time I placed the order I did not know that I had to order a separate UBS to transfer photos to my computer for printing. Also, if you need to take photos in the spur of the moment; you need to wait until battery is charged. You will need to anticipate when you will need the camera or rely on your phone. Otherwise takes decent photographs although camera has been discontinued by manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I own other cannon cameras and this one is a great addition to the collection. It works great and it's really easy to use. Plus it is versatile enough to take special shots. Automatic is fantastic for clicking away, but it allows me to easily use more professional settings too. The PDF download manual is easy to understand. Great camera. I have a Samsung ST66 and I really like that camera except the weak flash. Indoors the flash is very limited. The Cannon flash works all the way across the room. 15 to 18 feet is no problem.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Blurry, pixellated images
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera because I needed to take pictures at a bridal shower. Based on the information provided I was excited about the auto scenes as well as the automatic adjustments to reduce blur. Unfortunately all of my pictures turned out very pixellated and the lighting was undesirable. I spent hours editing the images to salvage the pictures and still had to discard many because they were blurry.
customer_reviews.author: shoe21

customer_reviews.title: Small and easy on auto mode
customer_reviews.text: Small and easy on auto mode. I like to have great pics with ease. It takes a bit of a learning curve as there are lots of settings if you want to haave different choices. Like the forced flash has to be set on LIVE mode, I use my camera on Auto and go. Night time pics and flash fill always take a bit of work to get to. Great for quick pics to capture memories.
customer_reviews.author: Elena M.

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera many years ago and use it constantly and it's still going strong! I bought a back-up (the same camera)just to have it as i depend on it to so much. Easy to use and great pics!!
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Brettell-vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the model it replaced.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older version of the same model that I had LOVED, but had just worn out. This version is slightly different, a little longer so it doesn't fit into the older case and has less settings options. It doesn't always focus on the subject in the center, sometimes focusing on the something in the background, making the macro shots disappointing. A bit annoying. All in all, it is not a bad camera for quick candid pics, but don't expect any artsy capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: L. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with a Canon camera. I am very impressed with its performance. I would have liked a manual with it rather than downloading it off of Canon's web site. Read the instructions carefully. This camera has more "bells and whistles" than I could imagine. It will take time and trial to get the best versatile use from it. An amazing camera. Thank goodness it is easy to take your initial auto pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Dummy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect quick solution to capture great photos.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 13 year old Nephew and he is over the moon about it. He is actually taking amazing pictures. I thought he wouldn't like it because he has a smart phone but his parents said this gives him more control and he doesn't get texted during a photo shoot. For the price and the joy, this is a great camera. His dad said he couldn't believe how easy it was point and shoot - he then saidn "They should call them Point and Shoot Cameras" uh...
customer_reviews.author: Mark H ✨

customer_reviews.title: Blurry pictures,
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my 16 year old and the camera is a cool and nice gift and looks sweet but when we developed the pictures we found that its missing the sharpness and has way less MP then stated and rather very poor when taken with the zoom . I think Canon should look into this issue since i have been a Canon fan for year but on this one they clearly failed.
customer_reviews.author: chung chen

customer_reviews.title: Incredible photos & so easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely! I just used it on a 7 day cruise & the pictures are awesome. I took a picture of the Caribbean to see if I could capture the color & the results are definitely beyond my expectations. This was taken simply on the Auto setting. I recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Grant

customer_reviews.title: BTW it does not come with a memory card - not even a small one but my old one worked just fine. Finally
customer_reviews.text: Not ecstatic. The settings are nowhere near as intuitive as my last canon powershot. And by the time I can get it set to "low light" or "action", the opportunity is usually long past. BTW it does not come with a memory card - not even a small one but my old one worked just fine. Finally, if it is out of space to take video, it doesn't tell you that is the problem; it just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3 Boys

customer_reviews.title: The ole Nikon vs Canon--------
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and well packaged. This is my first Canon & confess that my prior camera (Nikon) had more features that I came to depend upon that this Cannon does not. Pictures are clear and sharp however, just not as many options on the camera itself.....somewhat a disappointment but given time hope to get used to it. (The Nikon started acting up after 13 months--just past the warranty period! Hence, the switch to Canon.) )
customer_reviews.author: A Tucson customer

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for a point and click, this will do it.
customer_reviews.text: So far it works as advertised. Very easy to use with one hand. Wish it took double AA or triple AAA batteries instead of a custom battery. The casing is very slick and gripping it sometimes when you're moving can be tough. Zoom works easy, so does the video controls. Recommend ordering a second battery when you order the camera because they are hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: A. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my teenage son and he seems to enjoy it. Takes a very solid picture, even when the user is moving around (only a little bit, if he was running a marathon I doubt it would be a stable image). Its easy enough to use and charges very quickly. Also pulling pictures off of it to load onto a computer is extremely simple.
customer_reviews.author: McLanius

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought the camera for my daughters trip to Australia. She took over 800 photos. The camera took great pictures inside and out, was easy to operate and she loved the purple color. I liked that the price was cheap enough so if it got damaged or lost she would have to worry.
customer_reviews.author: Brent W

customer_reviews.title: For the price, a good camera although special effects options are hard to figure out on it
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera, but seemed to have issues with motion blurring which my lower priced Kodak camera didn't. Also wish it was more weather and shock proof like the Kodak brand had been. What offsets it is that it does have a range of other tools and options (which I haven't figured out how to work- sepia toned pics, and other effects) which make it just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M. Myers

customer_reviews.title: It takes very nice pics but when I tried to download them to ...
customer_reviews.text: It takes very nice pics but when I tried to download them to my computer it wouldn't work. Luckily I have another canon so I took out the memory disk and put it into my other camera and loaded them on like that.
customer_reviews.author: summer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera for the money. Easy to use and fits nicely in purse or pocket.
customer_reviews.author: KATHY

customer_reviews.title: great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: great camera for the price. need some extra scene modes and that is the reason for only 4 stars. but for somebody who uses only auto mode, this is great deal. grandparents, who are scared from any "new" electronics, are using it with ease and getting some nice pictures both over day and in low light.
customer_reviews.author: Ookie

customer_reviews.title: Quick easy shots for a nice price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera. Easy to operate and handle. It automatically picks the best setting for what you are focusing on so you don't have to fiddle with that. I got this for taking product photos in my light box. It does a nice job. I don't think the photos are quite as sharp as the camera I had before but that camera was a lot more frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Farmer

customer_reviews.title: who does not like complex, high-tech gadgets
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for my mom, who does not like complex, high-tech gadgets. This is a great base-model camera for individuals who are not tech savvy. No manual adjustment features, but it does have video and burst-shot capabilities, and, as with any Canon, takes great pictures. Be aware, however, the camera does not come with a memory card or data cable.
customer_reviews.author: N. Nowosad

customer_reviews.title: A good backup to a SLR
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably sharp photos, but has some drawbacks. The small zoom knob makes composing difficult and low light situations result in reduced photo quality. I purchased it for times when I may not want to carry my digital SLR as this much smaller camera can be slipped in a small case on your belt.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa Z

customer_reviews.title: takes good shots when used by the untrained
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a simple point and shoot camera for general family use when a camera was needed. This camera .takes good shots when used by the untrained.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: The specs on cameras get better every year
customer_reviews.text: The specs on cameras get better every year. As does ease of use. They have been at this a long time, and getting better and better a long time. Definitely a camera worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Nahatz

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Arrived without a battery. After purchasing and installing battery, discovered 2 cracks in display screen and no display. Shutter doesn't work. Obvious prior damage to case. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Utah Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love it and have used it for indoor and out door use with out problems. I waited to buy the extra cord because most of us have so many plug in cords that I found one in the house that fit the camera easily. I have tried other cameras and they were always so complicated that it drove me nuts. would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather J. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Big waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a total waste of my money. It took horrible pictures. I gave up and put it in storage. I would never recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Great pics for a cheap price
customer_reviews.text: Love the pictures and the easy use of this camera. My husband has the earlier version, and I loved it so much that I gave up my Kodak camera. Easy to use an download onto the computer. If you buy this be certain that you have a SD card to go with it, as it is sold separately.
customer_reviews.author: tacmtz

customer_reviews.title: She teaches 4 year olds and wanted a light easy to use camera to capture her students at work ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter, She teaches 4 year olds and wanted a light easy to use camera to capture her students at work and play. This camera fits the bill on all accounts. She is very pleased at the quality of the pictures and the ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Poplawski

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. This was a gift for my husband. He is not a fan of my Canon Rebel dslr camera that he bought me a few years ago for over $1000. He loves this camera. It's easy to use. It fits in your pocket. It's also easy to upload pictures, and they've all turned out great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Shauver

customer_reviews.title: Takes good pictures but because of the "proprietary" battery
customer_reviews.text: Takes good pictures but because of the "proprietary" battery, you have to take the charger along with you on vacation or risk having the camera "die" on you. I like the quality of the video it takes. Would be a much better product if it used AA batteries like the Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Merlinfan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: not the best quality pics, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a nifty little camera. I bought it for a trip to Europe and also got a 32 G card. Now I can take thousands of photos. I don't use all the features, just put it on auto and away I go.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie Thelen

customer_reviews.title: Love This Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. I've been using it off and on for a year. I've had no problems with it and love the pictures it takes. Very worth the price, which was $89 at all stores selling it in December 2014.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good resolution, color, & zoom function.
customer_reviews.text: No printed instruction manual with camera, must be downloaded & since this is an older model the download is a little hard to find. But if you have a printer & perseverance, it is a great camera- good color, resolution, and zoom lens. It's small but takes great pictures !
customer_reviews.author: NvSkip

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pocket Camera
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera that fits in your pocket. It takes good pictures and has an easy to use zoom feature. It also takes video, but I have never used the feature.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great compact camera. Photos are sharp and videos although shaky are very good at HD. I wish the company could have sent a manual instead of an "on-line" reference. I also looked for "merging videos" but does not show how to do it. A good buy. Too bad Canon has discontinued this item.
customer_reviews.author: JSR

customer_reviews.title: This camera has many more features than I will ever ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera has many more features than I will ever use, but once its software is fully loaded into a PC, is relatively simple to take "point and shoot" photos, import them to a PC, and do desired edits such as "auto correct" and cropping. Found loading necessary software a bit more complex than I'd prefer, but once this is done photo taking should be a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Winter

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise you get great pictures.
customer_reviews.text: My only advise would be to watch the lighting around ... reflections etc. will diminish the power of the flash. Otherwise you get great pictures ... most you don't even have to edit if taken properly.
customer_reviews.author: W. Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Great backup!
customer_reviews.text: Great little backup camera for my Nikon DSLR. Really compact, but powerful. Took a while for me to stop trying to look through my view finder, since it doesn't have one, but even an old photographer can get used to the viewing screen after a while.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hall

customer_reviews.title: A nice camera, but didn't suit our needs
customer_reviews.text: Returned this almost immediately. After we received it, we decided it did not have all the features we wanted. A nice camera, but didn't suit our needs.
customer_reviews.author: phantomdeity

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price.
customer_reviews.text: nice camera, some of the older models take better pics than this. Pics are clear but LCD is poor quality. Settings are pretty basic too. Love the color choices and for the price its not a bad buy. I have just owned other canon point and shoot cameras and expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Zinnia

customer_reviews.title: A great hit with my youngest grand-daughter
customer_reviews.text: A great hit with my youngest grand-daughter, who's well on her way to filling a 16gig sd card (Thanks Samsung) with snap shots of dogs, cats, birds, siblings, and anything/one else she can frame in the display! Thanks Amazon & Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Handy little camera  :)
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a nice camera that I ruined. I just took it on vacation to Yellowstone and I was very impressed with it. It's handy because I can slide into my pants pocket and it takes great pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Joy L Roszel

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera, very light and quiet. Not enough operating instructions. Battery (rechargeable) does not seem to last long, low battery after approx 25 pics. My old Fujifilm camera (similar) gets about 50 pics off two AA batteries. But I like it.
customer_reviews.author: KMunn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and good features
customer_reviews.text: This camera took many awesome shots while we were on bumpy terrain on a bus in Alaska. The wide lens feature is great and zoom is exceptional. The only complaint I have is that they do not include an instruction manual with it. Very difficult to get operating instructions on line.
customer_reviews.author: Angelfeather

customer_reviews.title: But the screen is terrible (to be expected in a $70 camera)
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 6 year-old as a first "real" camera. She loves the 10-second timer, and taking pictures of our cat. But the screen is terrible (to be expected in a $70 camera), and the images are poor in low light. Buy for the price, it's alright.
customer_reviews.author: J. King

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect camera for my 11 yr.old niece. Takes great pictures! Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L

customer_reviews.title: My New Camera.
customer_reviews.text: Did not arrive with memory card. I have had it a couple months and still not used it. I live very far from town, am elderly and no longer drive. Makes it a worthless purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cathie B. Colvin

customer_reviews.title: I love my new little camera
customer_reviews.text: I love my new little camera. It takes incredible pics and its dummy proof. I highly recommend for anyone wanting to get good shots of the grandkids,graduations,birthdays, etc. you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bertha Lorona

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Camera takes good pictures and its small perfect for preschool pictures
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Lewis

customer_reviews.title: works great but style is not as elegant as I would like - picture doesn't give size comparison
customer_reviews.text: I would look at this in the store if you can - small but thought it was bigger so Im not sure the style is what I was looking for I'm sure it works great
customer_reviews.author: Rated Fairly

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: My 5th or 6th PowerShot camera, definitely the worst of the lot. Absolutely no image stabilization whatsoever and even the slightest object movement results in a huge blur. So yes, if you merely want to photograph grass grow, this is the camera to get.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed, plastic
customer_reviews.text: very disappointed, plastic, have a time trying to get the door open where battery and SD card are made very cheap, nothing like my previous one doubt the door flap will last too long went back to using my old one, never could down load manual on my little computer, Thought cannon was always a good name not any more
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Cannon  Compact Power Shot ELPH 135 Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: Very good investment for an all around, easy to use, digital camera. Excellent size for those fast, unexpected moments when a camera is just the thing for capturing the shot. Some improvements are desired for faster focus and bright light conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Denton

customer_reviews.title: Good clear pictures
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding digital camera. It also take movies. Good clear pictures. I would recommend to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: sammy

customer_reviews.title: Nice basic camera
customer_reviews.text: Inuse this camera on a daily basis. It takes pretty good pictures in all conditions in the auto mode. It's hard to go wrong with the Canon point and shoot cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Braden Wood

customer_reviews.title: Works great. It was a Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: Works great. It was a Christmas gift, and still working 1 year later. Easy to use and figure out.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. The flash on ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. The flash on this is way too strong. Any time I have to use flash the images seem very washed out even if my subjects aren't standing close. The materials on the camera feel cheap and I worry that the raised lens compartment on the front is going to lead to lots of dings and scratches quickly.
customer_reviews.author: ssejw

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. Smaller than a pack of cigarettes
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Smaller than a pack of cigarettes. Powerful lens. Terrific zoom capacity, and less than $80. Who could ask for more?
customer_reviews.author: Ron Browne

customer_reviews.title: GREAT, FANTASTIC...
customer_reviews.text: ONE OF THE BEST CAMERAS I'VE EVER HAD AND I HAVE MANY...
customer_reviews.author: LIZ TORRES

customer_reviews.title: She loves it so am pleased with that aspect
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my 9 year old granddaughter. She loves it so am pleased with that aspect. However, I was surprised that it did NOT come with a memory card, that's why I only gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: El Abuelo

customer_reviews.title: Love the camera
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera. Great to haul around in my purse and do quick shots of my kids. Great picture quality. 2nd cannon powershot in 10 years and have LOVED them both. After my first one I wanted to upgrade to more megapixels. Got a Nikon and didn't like the picture quality. So I quickly ordered another cannon. Should have just done it from the start.
customer_reviews.author: jade rencher

customer_reviews.title: Works well.  Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Easy to use. Bought it for my 9-year-old daughter. Good compromise on cost vs. quality (as opposed to a more expensive SLR).
customer_reviews.author: Sliver111

customer_reviews.title: one of my best cameras yet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to take to concerts with me. Works very well. Takes amazing pictures. Totally worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria  Toler

customer_reviews.title: Love this Canon camera
customer_reviews.text: My husband left my camera on TOP OF HIS CAR ...and ...DROVE OFF! Had to replace my Canon camera and all it's accoutrements. Love this Canon camera!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra A. S. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great little "work" camera
customer_reviews.text: Good simple camera. Perfect for captureing photos of equipment and issues at work. Easy to operate, compact and good quality camera.
customer_reviews.author: cheekh

customer_reviews.title: A little more complicated than expected. Difficult to manually ...
customer_reviews.text: A little more complicated than expected. Difficult to manually change lighting modes. If you accidentally save a photo, you cannot un-save it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little camera for my budding photo kiddo! I've even snagged it a few times as a point and shoot companion to my DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. Its easy to use, takes great pictures, movies. Its easy to switch between movies and photos. To change settings such as picture size is easy and intuitive. I'm especially hard on camera's and I've dropped it many times on hard surfaces and it still works.
customer_reviews.author: Mary m

customer_reviews.title: but from what I've seen all results are good.
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to digital cameras, but from what I've seen all results are good.
customer_reviews.author: ron northrup

customer_reviews.title: This camera takes fantastic pictures for the size and price
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes fantastic pictures for the size and price! I am very happy with it. The battery life is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Nice small camera!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I was a little upset that the case didn't come with it, but that was my fault I didn't read the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Candace Flamm

customer_reviews.title: I do not think I get as sharp and good color with this camera as I did with my ...
customer_reviews.text: I do not think I get as sharp and good color with this camera as I did with my Sony Cyber Shot.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre Camera
customer_reviews.text: Not the best Canon Elph. I used to own a Canon Elph that died after 5 years of use and abuse. I purchased this one thinking it would be another fine little camera; however, I didn't realize it did not have built in image stabilization, and my pictures came out mostly blurry! I sent it back and Amazon graciously refunded my purchase amount within two days. I purchased a new camera, the Olympus sz-15, and I am really pleased. The Olympus outperforms the Canon that I returned, and is the best camera I've owned. I have owned Canons and Panasonic Lumix, but the Olympus is much superior. To conclude: I would NOT recommend the Canon Elph 135 to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: James Clark

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 8 year old. She loves it. They pictures look great, and it's battery life seems good so far. Wish it came with an SD card though, even a small one.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. So easy to use for a newbie.
customer_reviews.author: Suesq

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for my kid.
customer_reviews.text: Great X-Mas gift for my son. Amazon's price was unbeatable. Product is a great entry-level point and shoot to introduce kids into photography and video editing. My son has had a blast photographing weekend hikes and the family dog. Good product for the price. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Not as good quality as older canon point and shoot ELPHs
customer_reviews.text: The body is plastic and the build feels cheap. Not as good quality as older canon point and shoot ELPHs.
customer_reviews.author: kitzu

customer_reviews.title: Good camera.
customer_reviews.text: No complaints here. Easy to use and makes the most of my poor photography skills.
customer_reviews.author: Jillanne M. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera. But we thought it would communicate with our computer wirelessly however to do so you need to purchase awireless memory card.
customer_reviews.author: Ham I Am

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift for my granddaughter and she loves ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my granddaughter and she loves it! It arrived very much sooner than we expected and we were able to take it when we visited her.
customer_reviews.author: james steel

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT! GREAT VALUE
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT! GREAT VALUE, PRICE, QUALITY, AND DESIGN. I AM A FIRM BELIEVER IN CANNON PowerShot cameras. I bought this one as a gift and she loved it! Highly recommend. Takes amazing photographs in a variety of settings.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wenger

customer_reviews.title: My step son loves this camera
customer_reviews.text: My step son loves this camera. He loves how clear the pictures are. He is very pleased with how they turned out when he had some pictures printed.
customer_reviews.author: Hard Rock Girl

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: I loved the camera, it takes nice quality pictures and the zoom is great. I wasn't happy that the camera does not have a feature to crop pictures that I have taken. Otherwise, it's a good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Rivera

customer_reviews.title: good camera, not great
customer_reviews.text: good camera, not great. slow recovery after picture is taken. Also very light. all plastic. My old Sd11is is made of aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Lex

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Great. And it can zoom in on things way farther away than needed, like looking through a telescope.

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera and great gift for my granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera and great gift for my granddaughter. She says it takes wonderful pictures that she can save to her computer.

customer_reviews.title: OK but!
customer_reviews.text: OK but dont care much for its autofocus and tiny controls.

customer_reviews.title: Good camera! But you will need to buy the USB cable.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice camera! But it doesn't include the USB cable. Thank God I had one. Nice pictures and nice videos!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife and she loves it. It's compact enough to carry it anywhere and the simplicity of operation further enhances the camera.

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot ELPH135 Digital Camera (Purple)
product_meta.description:
Color:Purple| Style:BaseThe Canon Power Shot ELPH 135 digital camera is point-and-shoot ease at its best. Slim and light enough to have ready whenever a special moment might happen, this camera makes it easy to turn any snapshot into a frame-worthy memory. The versatile 8x optical zoom lens gives your images lots of variety while helping you capture action from near or far. The 16 megapixel image sensor brings high resolution to every detail, while the DIGIC 4+ image processor delivers fast performance and beautifully natural color. Shooting is easy in all kinds of situations with Smart AUTO that recognizes 32 scenes and chooses the perfect camera settings for you. Digital IS reduces blur automatically, and a handy Help button provides easy explanations of settings and options right on the LCD screen.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

BEAUTIFUL MEMORIES MADE EASY
The PowerShot ELPH 135 camera is point-and-shoot ease at its best. Slim and light enough to have ready whenever a special moment might happen, this camera makes it easy to turn any snapshot into a frame-worthy memory. The versatile 8x Optical Zoom lens gives your images lots of variety while helping you capture action from near or far. The 16.0 Megapixel sensor brings high resolution to every detail, while the DIGIC 4+ Image Processor delivers fast performance and beautifully natural color. Shooting is easy in all kinds of situations with Smart AUTO that recognizes 32 scenes and chooses the perfect camera settings for you. Digital IS reduces blur automatically, and a handy Help Button provides easy explanations of settings and options right on the LCD screen.

SPECTACULAR LENS POWER FOR STUNNING IMAGES
8X OPTICAL ZOOM
The PowerShot ELPH 135 features an 8x Optical Zoom so more shots are within your reach. You'll love the flexibility that the wide 28–224mm (35mm equivalent) shooting range offers. Plus, the Wide-Angle lens captures expansive image in every shot, adding depth, perspective and grandeur. Landscapes, city scenes, family shots and more benefit from the extra width. Whether you're shooting wide group shots or zooming to the telephoto end, your images are assured to be bright and clear.

BEAUTIFUL IMAGES AND INCREDIBLE PERFORMANCE START HERE
16.0 MEGAPIXEL SENSOR
With the PowerShot ELPH 135 camera's 16.0 Megapixels of resolution, your images are rich and clear, with textures and tiny details faithfully reproduced even at the long end of the 8x Optical Zoom. This high level of resolution is ideal for creating the largest prints, and allows you the flexibility to blow up and crop any section of an image to express your creativity.


DIGIC 4+ IMAGE PROCESSOR
The PowerShot ELPH 135 camera's DIGIC 4+ Image Processor features accelerated processing speed to create fast, responsive performance, giving you a shooting experience that's easy and natural. The DIGIC 4+ Image Processor also enhances image quality in several ways. Processing of high ISO shots has been shortened by 60% compared to the DIGIC 4 Image Processor. This significantly reduces noise for brilliant color, smooth gradations, and beautiful detail even in low light. The processor's highly efficient design also extends battery life. 

GORGEOUS HD VIDEO FROM YOUR STILL CAMERA
720P HD VIDEO
Using the slim PowerShot ELPH 135, you can shoot high definition video anytime, anywhere. With a simple push of the dedicated movie button, you'll be able to instantly record every moment in motion. 720p HD video is smooth, vivid, and beautifully lifelike, making it an ideal way to capture special moments with the family. 

A SMARTER CAMERA MEANS BETTER PHOTOS AND VIDEOS
SMART AUTO
Getting that great shot is as simple as pressing the shutter button on the PowerShot ELPH 135 camera. Smart AUTO automatically detects scenes by assessing various factors in both the background and the subject and analyzes them using 32 predefined shooting situations. The camera then makes optimal settings to ensure the best possible image capture, whether you're shooting stills or video. With Smart AUTO, all you have to do is frame your shot and capture away.

SHOOTING MODES
Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Program The camera automatically and intelligently selects the aperture/shutter speed combination based on the shooting conditions. Live View Control Enables Brightness, Color, and Tone adjustments to your images using easy-to-understand controls. Digital IS The camera digitally corrects image blur by analyzing the subject prior to choosing the best correction method. Portrait Brings the subject into focus while beautifully blurring the background. Low Light For high quality image capture in an amazing range of dimly lit situations. Fisheye Effect Now you can get the fisheye effect – a classic photographic distortion – without a fisheye lens. Miniature Effect Give images a miniature look with an effect that emphasizes perspective by blurring the top and bottom of the image. Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with "toy" or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect. Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue. Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts. Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint. Fireworks Create brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Long Shutter Use to blur moving subjects for artistic effect, ideal for urban night photography. Movie Record video; unwanted scenes can be deleted in playback mode. Actual results may vary from examples shown above.
Final image may vary depending on picture composition.

SAY GOODBYE TO BLUR
DIGITAL IS
Digital IS beats the blur that mars many shots by recognizing the main subject, then automatically applying the camera shake correction that best suits the situation. If the subject is a person, blur reduction processing is performed. For landscapes, cityscapes and other still scenes, the camera takes 3 quick successive shots and composes them into a single clear image. If the subject is moving, the camera takes 3 successive shots and then automatically saves the clearest image.

MORE WAYS TO GET CREATIVE
CREATIVE SHOOTING MODES
The PowerShot ELPH 135 provides shooting modes that easily give your shots a distinctly artistic feel without the need for any extra lenses and filters. Super Vivid heightens and saturates colors for eye-popping intensity. Poster Effect eliminates gradations between colors for an illustrative feel. Miniature Effect enhances perspective in a scene, blurring the top and bottom to make it look as if it were created with miniature models. You can also make a quirky portrait using the Fisheye Effect or add a beautiful single-tone effect with Monochrome. Toy Camera Effect simulates a vintage look as if capturing the photo using a "toy" or pinhole camera.

A CHARGE THAT LASTS AS LONG AS A MEMORY
ECO MODE
The PowerShot ELPH 135 features ECO Mode to provide more shots per single charge through LCD monitor and camera power management. The mode can be activated via a dedicated button for easy power preservation when you are out for the day or the moment is too important to put the camera down. ECO Mode quickly wakes the camera from sleep when a button is pressed so you won't miss the moment.

HELP YOU WON'T NEED HELP TO FIND
HELP BUTTON
The PowerShot ELPH 135 camera is designed to be fun and easy to use, even for beginners. A Help Button on the camera's exterior brings up the help menu any time you need it, right on the LCD screen. From here, you can scroll through a variety of topics that answer your questions with clear explanations, offer helpful shooting advice, and show you diagrams highlighting the position of any buttons you'll need.
feature_bullets: 16 megapixel 1/2.3-inch CCD sensor with DIGIC 4+ image processor
8x optical zoom, 4x digital zoom and 32x combined zoom
2.7-inch TFT color LCD with wide viewing angle
Shoot 720p HD video with a dedicated movie button
Features include Help button, Smart AUTO, Scene modes, built-in flash and ECO mode
